titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Jesse Ely Wills Papers

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections Manuscripts and Rare Books

repository.corpname: Special Collections Manuscripts and Rare Books

bioghist.p: Jesse Ely Wills, 1899-1977, a Nashville native, was a member of the group of poets who met in Nashville in the early 1920's to write and publish the influential literary magazine The Fugitive. He was an officer and executive of the National Life and Accident Insurance Company during his business career and was active in Vanderbilt University affairs as a member of the Board of Trust and chairman of the Board of the Joint University Libraries.

scopecontent.p: This collection contains literary correspondence, poems, and manuscripts of poet and businessman Jesse Ely Wills.

note.p: Arranged chronologically. 484 letters, the bulk of which consists of typed carbons.
492 letters, most typed, many holograph. Six postcards, three Christinas cards. Two telegrams. Arranged alphabetically according to sender.

did.unittitle: Enclosures - Miscellaneous essays and reviews by Jesse E. Wills

Essays by others, reprint essays of others
Items showing his relationship with Allen Tate
Old Oak and Coffee House Papers, including drafts and later supplements to the papers

Nashville and Other Poems - Notes and early drafts, intermediate and final drafts, typescript (printer's copy), page proofs
Selected Poems - Early drafts, page proofs, correspondence reviews
A Diversity of Interests - Draft copies, typescript, printer's copy, correspondence, essays not included in the publication, published copy in paper covers
"First Lady" - Several drafts of a contemplated poem on Mrs. John F. Kennedy, Not completed
Vanderbilt affiliations - Correspondence and reports concerning committee work
